00085 Resource *Micropolis::getResource(const char *name, Quad id)
00086 {
00087     Resource *r = resources;
00088     char fname[4096];
00089 
00090     while (r != NULL) {
00091         if (r->id == id && strncmp(r->name, name, 4) == 0) {
00092             return r;
00093         }
00094         r = r->next;
00095     }
00096 
00097     // Resource not found, load it from disk
00098 
00099     // Allocate memory for the resource administration itself
00100     r = (Resource *)newPtr(sizeof(Resource));
00101     assert(r != NULL);
00102 
00104     r->name[0] = name[0];
00105     r->name[1] = name[1];
00106     r->name[2] = name[2];
00107     r->name[3] = name[3];
00108     r->id = id;
00109 
00110     // Load the file into memory
00111 
00113     sprintf(
00114         fname,
00115         "%s/%c%c%c%c.%d",
00116         resourceDir.c_str(),
00117         r->name[0], r->name[1], r->name[2], r->name[3],
00118         (int)r->id);
00119 
00120     struct stat st;
00121     FILE *fp = NULL;
00122 
00123     if (stat(fname, &st) < 0) {  // File cannot be found/loaded
00124         goto loadFailed;
00125     }
00126 
00127     if (st.st_size == 0) { // File is empty
00128         goto loadFailed;
00129     }
00130 
00131     r->size = st.st_size;
00132     r->buf = (char *)newPtr(r->size);
00133     if (r->buf == NULL) { // No memory allocated
00134         goto loadFailed;
00135     }
00136 
00137     // XXX Opening in text-mode
00138     fp = fopen(fname, "r"); // Open file for reading
00139     if (fp == NULL) {
00140         goto loadFailed;
00141     }
00142 
00143     // File succesfully opened. Below here we must always close the file!!
00144 
00145     // XXX This may break due to use of text-mode
00146     if ((int)fread(r->buf, sizeof(char), r->size, fp) != r->size) {
00147         fclose(fp);
00148         goto loadFailed;
00149     }
00150 
00151     // File-load ok !!
00152     fclose(fp);
00153 
00154     r->next = resources;
00155     resources = r;
00156 
00157     return r;
00158 
00159 loadFailed:
00160     // Load failed, print an error and quit
00161     r->buf = NULL;
00162     r->size = 0;
00163     fprintf(stderr, "Can't find resource file \"%s\"!\n", fname);
00164     perror("getResource");
00165     return NULL;
00166 }
00167 
00179 void Micropolis::getIndString(char *str, int id, short num)
00180 {
00181     StringTable *tp, *st;
00182 
00183     // Try to find requested string table in already loaded files.
00184     tp = stringTables;
00185     st = NULL;
00186     while (tp != NULL) {
00187         if (tp->id == id) {
00188             st = tp;
00189             break;
00190         }
00191         tp = tp->next;
00192     }
00193 
00194     if (st == NULL) {
00195         // String table is not loaded yet -> get it
00196 
00197         // Create new string table
00198         st = (StringTable *)newPtr(sizeof(StringTable));
00199         assert(st != NULL);
00200 
00201         st->id = id;
00202         Resource *r = getResource("stri", id);
00203         Quad size = r->size;
00204         char *buf = r->buf;
00205 
00206         // Count number of lines in loaded file, terminate each line
00207         Quad lines = 0;
00208         for (Quad i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00209             if (buf[i] == '\n') {
00210                 buf[i] = '\0';
00211                 lines++;
00212             }
00213         }
00214 
00215         // XXX What about termination of last line?
00216 
00217         st->lines = lines;
00218         st->strings = (char **)newPtr(size * sizeof(char *));
00219         assert(st->strings != NULL);
00220 
00221         // Store starting points of texts in st->strings array
00222         for (Quad i = 0; i < lines; i++) {
00223             st->strings[i] = buf;
00224             buf += strlen(buf) + 1;
00225         }
00226 
00227         st->next = stringTables;
00228         stringTables = st;
00229     }
00230 
00231     // st points to the (possibly just loaded) string table
00232     assert(num >= 1 && num <= st->lines); // Stay in range of the file
00233 
00234     strcpy(str, st->strings[num - 1]);
00235 }
